channel.title: -=Help on getting No-Ip into use! *PLEASE READ!*=-
channel.description:
Hello, I am a beginner on server making and I have read on how to create my own private server, I have gotten everything down except that when I test my server, my server still uses my IP address, now I want to use my No-Ip ip, which is xfuryxscape-pk.no-ip.org, I have downloaded the No-Ip program and I have made an account and all that, but it's not taking it on the server! How do I get it to use my No-Ip ip instead? Please take time and try to help. Thanks. :)
-X F U R Y X

item.title: -=Help on getting No-Ip into use! *PLEASE READ!*=-
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

okay, I’ll try it with only 1 No-ip… thanks

Read full topic

if you have more than 1 you dont know which 1 to use

item.title: -=Help on getting No-Ip into use! *PLEASE READ!*=-
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

I know, I don’t have wireless router so I skipped the port forwarding, but I don’t get how to get the No-Ip to work… Did you guys just add the host and then started your server and then used your No-IP and it worked???[br][size=1]Posted on: October 20, 2007, 03:03:55 PM[/size][hr]Again, Am I allowed to have more than on No-IP on the list and still have it work or I can only have one host??

Read full topic

item.source: -=Help on getting No-Ip into use! *PLEASE READ!*=-

item.title: -=Help on getting No-Ip into use! *PLEASE READ!*=-
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

click start and then click run.
make sure you have this as your path “C:\WINDOWS\system32”
if you dont type:

cd C:\WINDOWS\system32

then type ipconfig
you should get something like…


        Connection-specific DNS Suffix  . : domain_not_set.invalid
        IP Address. . . . . . . . . . . . : ###.###.#.###
        Subnet Mask . . . . . . . . . . . : ###.###.###.#
        Default Gateway . . . . . . . . . : ###.###.#.#

then open up your web browser and put in the ip of

Default Gateway . . . . . . . . . :ips here

then when you get a pass and user name access panel:

try putting in admin as pass and username justusername or just pass

then post a picture what it looks like

Read full topic

item.title: -=Help on getting No-Ip into use! *PLEASE READ!*=-
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

ok this is how i host my server
www.no-ip.com
make an account
go to add host
in host name write your servers name
and under that it says no-ip.biz you can change that if you want
then screw the rest
go down and press add host
wait 5 minutes
open server
pray that people will acually go on.

btw you have to close your firewalls

Read full topic
item.source: -=Help on getting No-Ip into use! *PLEASE READ!*=-

item.title: -=Help on getting No-Ip into use! *PLEASE READ!*=-
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

I have DSL connection. Is that what you’re looking for? And also, yes, it has the smiley thing with the sunglasses and when I click on it, it turns to some other smiley with like a reddish cheek… and then it says something about not needing to updated since it’s already up-to-date… umm, like I said again, I have gone to the command prompt, typed in ipconfig, enter, then typed in the default gateway onto an address bar in a web browser, but nothing really happens…
Any more suggestions?

-X F U R Y X
P.S, um, right now I’m on a different computer than the one with my server on it (The internet is down for some reason.) so I don’t know if I might of done something wrong, buit right now I’m just trying to comfirm how exactly you can use it… just after you added the domain and once you started your server you can just go onto it with your address?

And also, would both my IP address and the No-IP address work to login to my server??
Thanks.[br][size=1]Posted on: October 19, 2007, 07:32:04 PM[/size][hr]So can anyone just write out the procedures to making the No-ip work? Like right everything as if I’m stupid, just to see if I missed anything… and if I didn’t then I’ll assume that it works, that I just have to try it again when I get my main computer back…

Thanks.

-X F U R Y X

Read full topic

item.title: -=Help on getting No-Ip into use! *PLEASE READ!*=-
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

Even if you’re using a wireless connection you still might be using a Router… So check if you have one and if you do then port-forward.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

I’m pretty sure I have mentioned that I have already registered… and yes, that’s is what I am asking you to help me on, how do I activate it?? I have read the tutorial and I have added a domain to my list thing (The program its provides) so is that activating it or do I have to do further more?
Also, no, I did not port forward since I am using cable no wireless connection… So do I still need to port forward? and if so, I actually kinda tried, I typed in my IP address on the web browser address bar… but it didn’t load so I suspected that I wouldn’t need to…

Read full topic
